meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6091.

td.p: Andrew Van Duyn, a junior from Wheaton, Illinois
Raya Elias-Pushett, a junior from Aventura, Florida
Nikhil Desai, a junior from Fremont, California

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):
Scores at the end of the Jeopardy! Round:

tr.td: THINGS TO DO IN THE USA
(Jimmy: ...and Museum. Clues about our beloved 16th president.)

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_DJ_6_1', 'clue_DJ_6_1_stuck', '(Kelly of the Clue Crew reports from the Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library in Springfield, IL.) Though it wasn\'t in original drafts of the Gettysburg Address, Lincoln ad-libbed this 2-word phrase--later added to the Pledge of Allegiance--& added it to copies like this one, which he wrote out later')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew reports from the Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library in Springfield, IL.) Though it wasn't in original drafts of the Gettysburg Address, Lincoln ad-libbed this 2-word phrase--later added to the Pledge of Allegiance--& added it to copies like this one, which he wrote out later

On February 5, 1862, the President & Mrs. Lincoln continually left a party to be by the bedside of this 11-year-old son, who died two weeks later--the only child of a president to actually die in the White House')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew reports from the Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library in Springfield, IL.) On February 5, 1862, the President & Mrs. Lincoln continually left a party to be by the bedside of this 11-year-old son, who died two weeks later--the only child of a president to actually die in the White House

The story goes that the dying Lincoln was cradled by Laura Keene, the star of this play that Lincoln fatally attended, leaving his blood on a piece of her dress')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew reports from the Abraham Lincoln Presidential Library in Springfield, IL.) The story goes that the dying Lincoln was cradled by Laura Keene, the star of this play that Lincoln fatally attended, leaving his blood on a piece of her dress

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '
AndrewWho is Poseidon?
$3,000
RayaWho is Poseidon?
$6,130
NikhilWho is Poseidon?
$13,601
Poseidon')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'Though Rhea was his mother, in one tradition this god was brought up by Capheira, the daughter of Oceanus')

tr.td: Though Rhea was his mother, in one tradition this god was brought up by Capheira, the daughter of Oceanus
